I mostly take pics of everyday living with silly boys and my husband who works cows, team ropes, and hunts.  so there is a lot of action going on.  this is  very quick and im never frustrated about the pics being blurry or not snapping in time.  it has a great focus also.  ive had this camera about 2 years and I haven't disliked it once! beautiful photos inside and outside! you will not regret buying this camera!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic images from such a small camera!
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Boyer
Reviews.Content: I am a DSLR user (Nikon D300) and my wife quickly tired of carrying around so much camera gear when we travel.  Well, someone has to carry the camera bag!  Just kidding!  She traded her Nikon D200 for this camera and loves it.  The menu is very much like other Nikon cameras--so, it is easy to adapt to it.  You really still have a lot of versatility and it is a fraction of the size and weight.  We bought the 10-30mm wide angle and the 30-110mm telephoto lenses.  She uses both lenses, but the 30-110 more frequently.  I wouldn't trade in my D300 for this camera but I would gladly borrow hers for a trip...

Reviews.Title: Great little thing
Reviews.Author: XXX
Reviews.Content: I bought the J1 because my Olympus E620 was really too heavy to carry it around with me every day. The Nikon is not quite the kind of camera you put into the pocket of your business jacket but it is small enough to fit into the smallest place in your bag. I just started to use it and made all sorts of shots, daytime, nightime, indoors, outdoors. It is intuitively usable (I didn't really consult the manual) even if you want to use the more complicate features like automaic aperture vs automatic shutter speed. The results are brillant, absolutely comparable to my Olympus E620 bright colours, great definition, One thing I like is that you do not have to bothe to switch off or on the flash. You just have to release it, it comes out of its slot and the next shot will be with flas light. Another thing which is great is how fast the Nikon is on. Just grab the objective, turn it so that it goes into shooting position, the camrera will be turned on in the meantime.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, great quality photos
Reviews.Author: Lezley
Reviews.Content: With 2 small children having a compact DSLR is a must! I got the Nikon 1 J1 to replace my Nikon point and shoot because I was sick of missing the photo opps due to waiting for the camera to take the photo. I am still learning all the settings but have already taken great photos of the kids.

Reviews.Title: What's the point?
Reviews.Author: Noirist
Reviews.Content: The Nikon J1 has an excellent DxO Mark score of 56, and it recently received an extremely favorable review from respected professional photographer Rob Galbraith. I'm looking for a compact camera to replace my wife's Panasonic DMC-ZS3 point-and-shoot, so I figured I'd give the J1 a try at a local store. To replace my wife's ZS3, the J1 has to take better pictures than the ZS3 both indoors and out, while in fully automatic point-and-shoot mode.On my first trip to the store, I took many pictures of my kids running around in the aisles of the store. I was impressed at how fast the J1 could shoot without slowing down and how quickly it appeared to autofocus on my cavorting children. But when I got home and uploaded the pictures to my computer, I was shocked to see that the pictures were all black, underexposed by more than four stops. WTF! The exif showed that the camera had been set to shutter priority with 1/3200 shutter and I didn't notice it in the store because all the pictures looked good on image review. So clearly whatever the J1 is showing on the LCD immediately after you take a picture is NOT the picture it saved on the SD card. Yes it's partly my fault for not checking the settings but the camera shares a significant amount of blame for (incorrectly) telling me that my pictures were good. Strike one.On my second trip to the store, I checked all the camera settings twice and put it in full auto. My kids couldn't attend, so I took pictures of things and people in the store. When I uploaded the pictures to the computer, I was pleased that the exposure was acceptable but disappointed that nearly every picture was washed out from what appeared to be flare from the overhead lights in the store (see attached images). Yes, the overhead lights were bright, but surely not bright enough to ruin all the pictures? Strike two.On my third trip to the store, I brought along a DMC-ZS3 compact camera, an LX3 premium compact, and a GH1 micro four-thirds with the 20mm f1.7 lens. I set all cameras to full auto, except the GH1 which I set to aperture priority f4.0 to simulate the GF3/GX1 14-42mm kit zoom lens. Surely the J1 would be able to best the ZS3 and LX3 with their much smaller sensors and older technology. But that was not to be the case... Unlike the other three cameras, the J1 had difficulty focusing on any of the subjects I chose; it was easily distracted by reflections and who knows what else. The slightest hint of backlighting caused the entire J1 image to be washed out, much more so than any of the other cameras. The resulting pictures are awful, worse even than the ZS3. Take a look at noirist's "Camera Test" set on flickr.Rob Galbraith has shown that it is possible to pull reasonable images out of the J1 outdoors at low ISOs, but my experience suggests that it is not easy to do so at higher ISOs, and certainly not in full auto. The electronic shutter of the J1 can cause severe image quality degradation at high ISOs for even mildly back-lit subjects. The very quick autofocus is only useful if you are willing to manually control the location of the autofocus point because the J1 does a poor job of choosing what to focus on in the presence of reflections and backlighting. Like the Nikon DSLRs, you must continually fiddle with all the J1 camera settings (autofocus mode, metering mode, exposure compensation, focus point, etc.) to get the best images. It's a lot of work for what? Even an old point-and-shoot superzoom can take better indoor pictures than the J1 with no effort at all, and if you're going to work that hard to get reasonable images from the J1 you might as well bring along a DSLR and get some truly outstanding images! Worst of all, the image review (which can't be turned off) is a complete lie. You can take horrible pictures with the J1 and not realize it until you get home and upload them to your computer.Bottom line: an amateur photographer looking to upgrade from a point-and-shoot would do better with micro four thirds, like a G3 or GX1. Those camera bodies with the new 14-42mm X series zoom are smaller than the J1 with any of its kit lens, and their sensors are twice as large (and hence capture twice as much light with better subject isolation). They offer many more native lenses of all sizes, speeds, and focal lengths, and Panasonic's intelligent auto "iA" system will let a novice take better pictures with much less work or skill than they can with the J1. A photographer willing and able to extract the best images out of the J1 will be disappointed when they realize they could have gotten much better pictures out of a Nikon 5100 or other DSLR for the same amount of work.Postscript 01/20/2012. Dpreview just published their review of the J1 and they agree - the J1 is neither for enthusiasts nor novices. "Enthusiasts will be disappointed by Nikon's focus on beginners, and that's fine - the 1 System really isn't designed for them. What worries us is that even genuine novices - those happy with point and shoot operation but who want a step up in terms of image quality and AF performance from their compact cameras - will find themselves poorly served by certain facets of the J1 and V1's design and performance.... Users ready to take control over camera settings may be frustrated with a camera designed primarily to be operated in fully automated mode.... The J1 will reward point-and-shoot upgraders with a noticeable bump in image quality, but often fails to deliver acceptable results in lower-light settings when operated in its fully automated mode."

Reviews.Title: Perfectly happy amateur
Reviews.Author: Scrumplemom "mom of 2"
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying using my J1 with the 10-30 and 30-110mm lens.  I haven't played around with it for long, but I bought it for ease of use and quality in the automatic setting, in low light and with moving objects (I have 2 toddlers).  So far it has performed far better than my Olympus compact SLR and almost as good if not better than my older Nikon D90.  My only regret so far is that the photos seem to have a slightly darker and yellower tint than what the screen - or real life shows you.  I am wondering if that is fixable with settings...UPdate:  Another thing that just happened is that after snapping about 10 shots consecutively with the flash I got a warning "flash is hot" and had to close it!  Uh oh....Not sure about this...

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot rarely needing flash for indoor photos.
Reviews.Author: James J Dory
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I compared a relative's N1 J1 to my panasonic Lumix compact, and the Nikon produced far superior images in low light without flash, which is how I prefer to use it. I was very surprised because my Lumix was the first compact camera I was aware of, that could produce decent no flash images indoors. The N1 J1 sent to me works exactly the same as my relative's NI J1. I was very surprised at how well the N1 J1 produces bright detailed images in automatic mode with no flash. I also own a Nikon D300 with many lenses and previously owned a Nikon D40x. The Lumix is lighter and more compact than the N1 J1, but the N1 J1 is sufficiently compact to carry in most situations.

Reviews.Title: A fantastic buy
Reviews.Author: Basi
Reviews.Content: I love this little Nikon camera. It offers a step between the big DSLRs and the pocket camera. I love the style, weight, size, and color options for this little baby. It takes amazing photos and allows for plenty of play in the settings. A great camera for someone just starting out with manual and interchangeable lenses.

Reviews.Title: Pretty darned impressed
Reviews.Author: retired_army_guy
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon 1 J1 with the 10-30MM lens and the 30-110MM lens in preparation for an Alaska cruise this summer.  I also purchased a polarizing filter.  Having only had point-and-shoot auto-focus cameras before, I am amazed by what I have been able to do with the Nikon 1 J1.  Maybe I'm easily impressed, but when I turned off the auto-focus and started tinkering with the settings, my pictures went from good to great.  I have now taken over 1500 photos in the few weeks I have owned this camera and am pretty comfortable with the different settings.  I use Continuous mode often and even use Electronic (Hi) mode for taking action shots and my pictures have been nothing short of amazing.  I've never owned a DSLR camera, so I can't compare, but for what I purchased it for - great photos, it fits the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great for those moving up from point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 8 months ago when the price was $100 more than it is now, which is pretty depressing. I have to say that after 8 months I love it though and I recommend the package with the zoom lens. If I want to buy the lens now it's still $250 as an add-on. The camera works very well on 'auto' setting but I have taught myself how to play with the aperture and shutter speed settings, which is very easy and fun to do once you get the hang of it. I bought this instead of the similar Sony NEX3 or similar version because this had a built in flash and others did not. However, this camera works so well in low light that I hardly use the flash, ever. The battery life is very good and the included charger works well. The zoom on the basic/included camera lens is good but not great which is why I now need the zoom lens. I also wish it had come with some sort of flat or pancake lens b/c it definitely won't fit in your pocket with the included lens and you can't take photos with it off, so if you really want the compactness of a point and shoot camera, this isn't it; it has a little bit of bulk to it. Often, when I take pics I get looks from other people who ask about the camera and I tell everyone that it's a great device.

Reviews.Title: So What is the fuss about? It's just another Camera, Right?
Reviews.Author: Neil Herdan "Fair and Balanced Reviews"
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera, after reading all the research and of course all the hype on TV, including commercials. Given that I have only used it for a few weeks, here are my preliminary thoughts.Pros-Menus and set up are easy and intuitive to learn-Camera is very robust-excellent for picture in video stability-can read most SD cards-Comes with a small print and larger manual on CD? with video editing instructions-large charger and powerpack battery included-camera has intelligent focus and can pick best shot optionsCons-The lens was very hard to install and the mounting cap was quite a struggle to remove and insert. The back of the lens would not unlock, when I tried to remove the dust cover and the lens took a while to lock into place-Contrary to advertising, this camera is heavy and I would not recommend bringing it for quick snapshots-There are a limited number of menu options and settings, so don't expect a lot of special effect features. Fortunately, I have two Panosonics for this type of photography.- You can not auto-focus the camera with its larger lens.-The flash is pop out and not automatic-Comes in only two colors, sorry no black yet.-the neck strap is sturdy, but hard to attach to the cameraAll in all you will like the Nikon 1 if you are serious about your photography, but all the media hype exceeds its true capabilities

Reviews.Title: Nikon J1
Reviews.Author: Al Dyess
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have Canon 5D for the heavy lifting, but I really like this camera for sight seeing, a quick picture, and even very simple HD video. Its especially useful for concerts, etc, where a big rig draws too much attention.

Reviews.Title: Better suited to those stepping up from point and shoot than a step down from DSLRs
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I tried this camera out for a couple days before ultimately returning it.Pros-Upgrade-ability of the glassQuick focusLots of optionsCons-Most of the features that you have at your fingertips on a DSLR are buried in menusNo hot-shoe (can't use a better flash)Proprietary glass (if they stop supporting this you are screwed- if you upgrade to full DSLR, you need all new lensesI believe those upgrading from a point and shoot will be satisfied but DSLR users may be underwhelmed if they are used to being able to control most of their settings easily.This still makes a good camera for DSLR users that want something that is better than a point-and-shoot but smaller than their DSLR, as long as they are willing to give up the ease of adjusting settings (example, your dial has 4 settings- none are M, A, S, or P- get ready to dig through menus).

Reviews.Title: Just hope you never have to send it in for repair
Reviews.Author: T. Dove
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera spur of the moment for a trip we took to New Orleans in May since I wanted a nice camera. And on the trip it took amazing pictures; right out of a post card you would think. BUT after the charm of having a really nice camera wore off I started to notice it's faults.First you better plan on taking pictures with it out in the sun or a really well lit area because otherwise the pictures do not come out good at all. Will say though when that is not the case the pictures come out amazing. And after having it a few months and tweaking with the settings I figured out how to make the pictures come out just OK in low light settings and learned the strengths/weaknesses to work around them.So I was ok with this and was still loving the camera for what it could do but then this happened. On Halloween night we're at a party and notice the flash isn't firing; odd so assumed maybe I had tweaked with a setting. After messing with it a bit finally realized that the $600 camera I had bought a mere 5 months ago had a dead flash. That's right within just 5 months a critical piece of the camera was dead and believe me if you're in low light settings without the flash you might as well use your camera phone.Contacted Nikon and within a few days they have me send it to their repair center; having me pay for shipping of course; and it has now been over a month. Just with a status of "PARTS ON HOLD" and no further contact. I'm sorry but for dropping $600 on a first gen product of theirs they need to do better than this and I am sorely disappointed in their service. I've missed Thanksgiving holiday and now most likely Christmas with an opportunity to take amazing pictures with my family.So take what you will from this review.UPDATE: 1/10/2013So here is the full history.- flash broke 11/01/2012- submitted repair request on 11/04/2012- after some back and forth told camera had to be sent in for repair on 11/10/2012- camera received by Nikon on 11/16/2012 and pretty soon placed in "Parts On-Hold"- contacted again on 12/20/2012 since there was no further communication or change- told on 12/22/2012 that a brand new camera would be sent due to the wait- still no status change or further contact as of 1/10/2012- contacted service by phone and told that they were waiting for a shipment and should get it by next weekYes you have read that right; 2 full months after being sent to Nikon and I still have nothing in my hands that I paid for. Do all my Christmas shopping early and had gotten my wife the new Nikon Coolpix for her purse but have since returned it since this experience was one of the worst and do not want to support the company anymore than I have to.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera and customer service
Reviews.Author: Peggy
Reviews.Content: I used this camera 2 times- then the flash broke- sent the camera in to be fixed, it took 5 weeks to get it back. Used it one time and the flash broke again. I called customer service and complained and asked them for some help- it took 8 phone calls, countless emails to get any answers at all. I finally sent it back so they could "fix" it again- at first they wanted me to pay shipping more phone calls, more yelling, they sent me a shipping label (big of Nikon). Again more phone calls- until they replaced the camera- duh- that's what I wanted in the first place.The tech guy said if you don't use the reccommmended memory cards you will screw up the camera...how dumb is that?Bottom line: DON"T BUY!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME camera - great deal - get it while you can
Reviews.Author: radphr
Reviews.Content: Yes - do not expect this to be a full frame DSLR - it does not claim to be that. The price is now a great value and most of the early reviews were influenced by the initial high price tag. Yes flash sink rate is fixed at 60 and there is some noise at higher ISO - but if you want to take great shots this will get the job done. Get your pics out of the computer and print large amazingly sharp pictures. This thing takes awesome video and is FAST. Spray and pray if you want - 10 FPS - this camera is just flat out fun. The Nikon1 lenses are not going to be discontinued any time soon - look at the new Nikon1 V3 - the investment is being made by Nikon.Recommended additional items: Get the Nikon leather body case and an extra battery. Get an SD air card and go wireless - connect to your devices. If you have old manual (Minolta MD/MC or other non-Nikon) prime lenses look at the 3rd party adapters - fun to shoot video and stills with instant lcd feedback (no metering, VR, or focus confirm with non-chipped adapters) - shake the dust off and put the old lens to use. Great for a beginner and great for everyday use - go manual if you want - the controls take some getting used to if you are accustomed to a dslr but it is not difficult.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Maria vega
Reviews.Content: So far this product was very easy to use. A little on the heavy side but takes beautiful pictures. I enjoy using it any chance I get.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for anyone who is learning photography
Reviews.Author: Richard Sorensen
Reviews.Content: This camera shoots excellent pictures and the video is outstanding. It has many of the features of more professional cameras, but won't break your wallet. It is a perfect camera to learn photography.

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: ShootRic
Reviews.Content: Purchased at Target on Closeout for $279 with 10-30mm lens. Found a refurbished 30-100mm lens for $99. Paid $30 for the Thom Hogan Nikon N1 Guide Book ([...] <<< Must Read for all N1 owners.95% of my images are taken with the camera mounted on a tripod and I set the timer for a 2 or 5 second delay. Manual mode is used 50% of the time and Aperture Priority the other 50%. The majority of my images are landscape, still life and individual portraits. ISO setting is 100 for most shots with an f8 or f11 aperture, RAW is used exclusively, matrix metering and center point focus point, single shot AF. The flash is never used and neither is the video mode nor shooting scenes. Also, I never installed the Nikon software so I can't comment on these features.Post processing in LR5 is minimal mostly cropping, levels adjustment, black & white conversion and sharpening. I print mostly 11x14 and have made one 20x30 poster print. Yes, I can see some grain if I view from a distance of one meter however, if viewed from 3 meters away or more the grain is not visible.The two features that I wish it had are exposure bracketing and the ability to view the histogram without having to hit the Playback button. However, with the type of photography I shoot I can afford to bracket manually. My experience shows the camera tends to overexpose a little but, it can easily be corrected in post processing. I use an external meter and shoot a calibration target before each shot so, it's OK. [...]Battery like is OK but, I did purchase two additional generic batteries and charger here on Amazon. Will buy the wireless remote next.Will begin experimenting with Time Lapse photography.If you do not get consistent and reliable results from this little unit, the problem is not the camera.

Reviews.Title: Loved the pictures but its very fragile
Reviews.Author: Dez
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera when I bought it about a year ago. It is still a point and shoot camera, but took amazing photos. It was really the first camera I bought of this price. Up until about a week ago, I would've given it 6 stars. But I dropped my camera onto my mattress from about a foot up and the camera wouldn't turn on. No matter what I tried, it wouldn't turn on. When I googled this, it turns out there is something inside the camera that isn't housed very securely and you could shake the camera and damage it. Also I've learned that Nikon limits their repairs to 22 stores in the entire US, or you have to ship it off for repairs. The quoted repair was $180. That is a bit pricey for a $400 camera, of which probably $250 is the cost of the lens. So I was very disappointed that this camera is so fragile and that repair is so costly and inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: A fine camera despite its small size
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: As an experienced photographer with a collection of high-end professional cameras, I found the Nikon 1 J1 to be a wonderful piece of equipment capable of producing outstanding pictures, once I got used to it. Its small size is its great virtue, especially when traveling under circumstances where schlepping a 30 lb bag of camera bodies, lenses and other paraphernalia would be inconvenient or worse. But it's smallness also means that its controls are tiny and not always intuitive to use. For example, it took me a while to figure out manual focussing (not at all explained in the manual), because there is no focusing ring on the lens. This only means that the camera takes a while to get used to. Also, the absence of a viewfinder required a bit of getting used to.  And there is no hot shoe for flash.  Other idiosyncrasies include a blue cast in shadows and more noise than I am used to with my other, large-sensor cameras, especially but not only at high ISOs. The cast is easily dealt with in Photoshop or other color- correction programs, and noise can also be controlled in post-processing. That said, the resulting photos are very good and often spectacular. The lenses are exceedingly sharp, the anti-vibration permits sharp hand-held pictures with the tele-zoom fully extended at shutter speeds as slow as 1/100, and the sensor is large enough to allow for superb prints as large as 13 x 19 (as large as my printer will produce) and probably larger.  All in all, this is a serious camera that, while it will not replace large, fully-featured DSLRs, deserves consideration by anyone looking to lessen the load of carrying heavy equipment.

Reviews.Title: Great little Nikon
Reviews.Author: Mary M. Guest
Reviews.Content: But I couldn't get past not having a viewfinder when I was shooting outdoors on a sunny day or shooting sports. Going to get the V2 that has the viewfinder and I think move down to this format entirely from my Nikon DSLRs. I just can't get over the convenience of the smaller size- the shots that the 1 series takes are great and completely comparable to my larger Nikons.

Reviews.Title: Nice Surprise, I actually love it.
Reviews.Author: LORRAINE A. MINOGUE
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant at first, wanted the Sony mirrorless.  When Amazon offered the price and payment option, my decision was made for me.  I am only a hobbyist but an adventurous one when it comes to playing with different cameras.  Started out shooting in the auto mode which I found to be overexposed but did my editing in post.  I've since switched to program, stepping it up and down as needed, and using the manual focus.  Results are wow!I am a Canon fan, really a fan, but this Nikon has blown me away.Shoots like a full size DSLR, but carries like a point and shoot, which gives an added benefit of different venues that won't allow cameras with "detachable" lenses.  The size alone has allowed for concert shooting.After saying the above, be aware of a few "quirks" of the J1...many lightweight plastic parts, especially the memory card and battery slot, which worries me.  There is no viewfinder, which I prefer to shoot through.  If you do flash photography (not a priority for me) the flash is not better than a point and shoot.  If these things are of importance to you look at the V1.  They are addressed in that model.I don't use the video function, sorry I can't comment on it for you.Gave it a five star after discovering what this little baby can do, I am really impressed and loving it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect compromise
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: I treat this as a great step-up from my sony point and shoot camera. I'm pretty hesitant to buy a DSLR because every time I borrow a friend's DSLR it feels to heavy in the neck.Pros: small form-factor, comes with built in flash (vs sony nex cameras,) takes clear photos, shutter lag is minimal (I hate it when it takes a while for point and shoots takes a few seconds to focus before taking a picture.)Cons: picture quality is not the same as the more expensive DSLRS. (You do pay for quality)Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase since I get to take better pictures without the hassle of lugging around a big heavy camera. Trying to save up money for the extra lens now. :)

Reviews.Title: excellent pictures, fast shooting rate, but no viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Robert Cullers "RCullers"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon 1 J1 camera has excellent picture quality (including raw files), is extremely fast focusing and has fast shooting rates (up to 60 frames per second). I bought it so that I have a small camera that is easy to carry around if I do not want to drag along my bigger Nikon single lens reflex camera. The biggest negative for me is the lack of an eyepiece view finder (the more expensive v1 version has this).  This means that you have to hold the camera out away from your eye so that the camera tends to move as you take the picture.  The camera in autoexposure mode tends to pick a slow shutter speed so that pictures may be blurred unless a tripod is used.  I avoid this by using the aperture priority mode at iso 400 or less so that I can change the aperture (lens opening) to make sure that the shutter speed is fast enough to avoid blurred images. Also the camera has an image stabilization mode so that blurry pictures are less likely at slower shutter speeds.  The 10-30 mm lens focuses down to around 8 inches so close to macro images may be obtained.  Some people may not like that the depth of field is large so it may be difficult to keep the background out of focus if, for instance, the foreground is in focus.  There are a lot of other small, mirrorless cameras now that the experts have tended to give better reviews than the Nikon 1 J1, but you should be able to get a lot of excellent pictures from this camera if you are careful about the exposure speeds.  I will not comment about the video since I do not often use it.

Reviews.Title: At this price, I'd expect more.  It's going back.
Reviews.Author: Stacie L. Helsing "stacielc"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an optional light small camera for travel, but it's going back.  I think that the lenses are probably great, but the sensor just cannot deal with low natural light.  I am not talking dark here.  I mean low inside daylight, with my front door open.  I can get many usable pictures with my D3100 using a comparable f lens in this lighting and no flash.  The flash also leaves a bit to be desired as well.  It's not very powerful and just leaves things looking sterile, and since you have no option to add one, you kind of are stuck.  I also did not feel as though the screen gave an accurate representation of what the images would look like later.  It seemed to be acceptable, but missed obvious blur that clearly was there.  This surprised me, since the screen seemed so clear...At this price point, I'd HIGHLY recommend the D3100 kit with 18-55mm.  It's honestly not all that much heavier or bigger and you get SOOOOOO much more for the money. It's the smallest and lightest DSLR Nikon makes and WELL worth every penny.  Add a 35mm f 1.8 for travel and night shots and you will find yourself saying "Nikon 1, what is the point?"

Reviews.Title: Great little camera especially with the FT1 adapter.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Murillo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera used and the product was as described and maybe even in better shape than I thought because it looks and works as if new.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: j
Reviews.Content: I am no professional photographer but I did want something compact and with interchangeable lenses. This is a great camera for those who like taking pictures but not quite a hobby to where you need a DSLR. It's easy to travel with and starts up quick so you don't miss those good shots. Just retract the lens and it's on.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for someone starting out!
Reviews.Author: Ron Chandler
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera a month ago and so far its great! My bundle came with an extra lens but I don't anticipate i will use the extra one very often if at all! The features are easy to understand and I've enjoyed trying all the various options!This is an awesome buy.

Reviews.Title: I like Nikon 1 J1
Reviews.Author: Chi Kyong Kim
Reviews.Content: It's very small and yet powerful: I takes both still pictures and video. It looks charming (white) that starts conversation with friends.I love it!

Reviews.Title: Epic
Reviews.Author: Robert Hineline
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best digital camera available. Functions just as well as a camcorder as a canon GL1. The end quality of both contributes to a production level of value for a ridiculous bargain base price.

Reviews.Title: just what I expected
Reviews.Author: kristin a
Reviews.Content: I researched this camera and other comparable models before purchasing this one and it is everything I expected it to be.  Very nice quality pics for the price of the camera - so much better than the $100 digital cameras I've been using in the past.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Kristy
Reviews.Content: I love my camera the quality of the pictures turn out so good! The camera is easy to use! I definitely recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: NIKON 1 J1  Love This Camera!
Reviews.Author: Bucknut
Reviews.Content: I Can't get away from this camera. It shoots very very fast and focuses very fast also! It's pretty light and pictures are oustanding considering it's a only a 10.1 megapixel  camera. I got this for a steal price on EBAY with 10-30mm and 30-110mm lens for 199.99. I also purchased the 10mm  pancake lens also. The video is also outstanding I was amazed at the quality! Also like the fact that you can take pictures while  recording video that's a nice feature. HDMI output is nice also for T.V viewing. If your looking for a small camera that takes high speed action shot's you can't go wrong here especially considering the price of this camera these days. This was a $599.99 camera in 2011.

Reviews.Title: great camera system
Reviews.Author: M. FUSCO "yawnmower"
Reviews.Content: I have a large array of mirror-less digital cameras, with and without interchangeable lenses, including Lumix and Leica sets.  Each one has its own characteristics and advantages.  I primarily take pictures of my active 2 1/2 year old granddaughter, so speed and accuracy of focus is of paramount importance.  I have missed quite a few good shots due to slow response and focusing.I found a good deal on the J1 and decided to give it a try, and I am glad I did.  I love the smaller (than four thirds systems) size, and the silver is a very attractive, and tough, exterior.  It is also very fast and has a nice set of lenses to go with it:  10mm, 10-30mm, and 30 to 110mm.  They are all very fast, with very smooth zoom rings, which make taking pics of a moving child much easier.  I believe I am having a higher rate of good, focused shots with this system.Just one problem:  I liked it so much I just had to get the J2 and J3 versions.  Each of those is even faster and more accurate, and good deals can be found if you look around.  I am a big fan, but find myself using the newer versions more.  But the J2 seems to be the most in demand.  Its speed is comparable to the J3, but has features available on the back of the camera similar to the J1.  For some reason, Nikon saw fit to remove them from the J3.  So the back is less 'cluttered', I suppose, but it is inconvenient to have to go into the menu for just about everything.

Reviews.Title: Price can't be beaten now
Reviews.Author: Chan Nyein Win
Reviews.Content: In terms of price and image quality, Nikon 1 J1 with 10-30mm can't be beaten so far. Nowadays, $300 price lag is for ordinary point and shot but you can expect J1 within the price range now . Bare in mind that  it used to be more than $700 in 2011 October. If you consider buying Nikon 1 J1 in 2013, you can't go wrong with having a mirrorless camera that has remarkably higher AF speed with superb image quality than any other P&S.;

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera for someone who wants more than a cheap digital or phone camera
Reviews.Author: S. Sonsteby
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect camera for learning a bit about photography, with more options than a cheap digital, or a phone camera. I've really enjoyed my results, and have much more to learn. Adding another lens has been fun, and I'm having a great time with it.

Reviews.Title: Go for it !
Reviews.Author: Ludovic J.
Reviews.Content: Nothing to say, Great transaction, perfect product. You can trust the saler it was a good deal ! Go for it !

Reviews.Title: What a bargain!
Reviews.Author: Anutkina
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pictures. It's sleek and light! Feels and works like a brand new item! Love it!!! The basic lense is ok.. If you want more zoom and options, recommend to buy a bigger lense separately.

Reviews.Title: Great for photographing soccer!
Reviews.Author: Jeff & Dawn Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter's soccer games because I read that it was fast.  My first time out I had excellent results with the 110 lens.  I selected "shutter priority" mode, bumped up the shutter speed and received clearly focused action shots. 10 frames per second with autofocus works wonderfully.  Recommend Nikon j1 for Dummies as I'm quite the novice with such vast functionality.

Reviews.Title: No I am not a profesional photographer. But I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: A. king
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing motion shots. I'm no pro, however it suits my needs and I love it! The motion picture shots are excellent!

Reviews.Title: Im in love.
Reviews.Author: F3nix
Reviews.Content: such a compact little thing  and so  efficient. i  love the speeds to  which  images can me shot  and the amount  of  detail in every  frame. i  would so  recommend this to  anyone who  has a little one whose steps you  literally  have to  chase. is perfect  for  lots of  different things. I'm so glad i  Got it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera at the right price.Like the quality of the video and the photos.Great for semi pro photographers.

Reviews.Title: Vacation in Peru
Reviews.Author: Carmen
Reviews.Content: The Camera work great, easy use, not too big and takes great pictures. Everyone loved the color and zoom lense was just as good as the more expense models.

Reviews.Title: Great Hi-Def Video
Reviews.Author: William F. Fox
Reviews.Content: I originally bought the camera as a light, high quality still camera but I've discovered that it also takes great Hi-Def video. Very crisp and detailed video looks great. Very efficient use of storage as well. A 32GB card just lasts and lasts. Be aware that buying this bundle is the only way to get a silver 30-110MM lense.

Reviews.Title: brakes down ALL the time!
Reviews.Author: Gen
Reviews.Content: Takes nice photos BUT broke 3 times since I have owned it!  I'm through with Nikon.  I bought this thinking it was the best thing out there at the time and paying big bucks for it... one day it just wouldn't turn on!  I called and they told me to send it back to Nikon.  After spending lots on shipping and insurance they did finally get it back to me fixed.  Not sure what was wrong with it in the first place.  then again 3 months later same thing and now again last week-end!  I give up!  Don't buy this product besides in order to take a picture you have to turn it on (if it turns on for you that is) then remove cap, turn lens then you can take a picture!  frankly, whatever I was trying to capture was long gone by the time I did all that!  very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Get the new 18.5 1.8 lens for a complete camera-
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey R. Bissell
Reviews.Content: If you really want to get the kids in action indoors the new 18.5 mm 1.8 lens is a necessity. This camera needed it for low light pictures indoors. It allows faster iso's and great sharp pictures with better shutter speeds. The camera really works best shooting at Manual and with full control of s speed and aperture. The cost of 186.00 for the 18mm makes this small beauty a work of art. I have a canon 6od and several sony canon point and shoots, but with the 1.8 lens the n1 becomes my choice for family and quick outdoor shoots-when I do not want to haul out the big Camera and lenses. Also have the 10 30mm lens.  With the 2.7 conversion factor that gives a pretty good range. It is becoming my favorite which I carry on a strap around my neck or back as it is so small and light I forget it's even there!

Reviews.Title: Nikon 1 J1 - Small & Impressive
Reviews.Author: dlv "Debbie"
Reviews.Content: I am not going to get all technical - there are enough reviews filled with comments on the technical merits etc. for the Nikon 1 J1.  I will say that I am a camera-addict (I currently have a Nikon D5100 (love it), Nikon D7000 (love it), and Nikon D90 (love it but it is being neglected a lot lately because of the D7000 and D5100.)  I also have various other point & shoots, etc.  I was drawn to the sleek white version of this camera - but fought the urge to puchase it for quite some time.  Then, I read an article in my Outdoor Photography magazine that had a spread on the merits of these new mirror-less cameras.... so I decided to purchase the Nikon 1 J1 kit that came with a 10 gig SD card and a nice & sturdy red leather case.  I have taken about 100 photos with it so far, and I am impressed.  It is ZIPPY FAST ... light and easy to use.  I bought a 30-100mm lens as well to go with it.  It isn't equal to my full size Nikon dSLRs (and certainly doesn't replace one) - but it does a very decent job and is a good small camera to cart around when I don't want to lug around my full size dSLRs.  I was amazed how fast the camera snaps shots - it certainly puts any of the regular point and shoots to shame. I would recommend the camera to anyone looking for a small camera that can take great photos with very little start up time.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Hennessey
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!  Takes great pictures.  Everyone loved it at our Easter party, and all the action shots came out great!This is a fun little camera!

Reviews.Title: A Sporty Jaunt
Reviews.Author: Ronald M. Piekosz "Human Being"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon J1 takes great photos.  The color is rich and deep.  You can snap off as many photos as you want in a series, and pick out the best one later, one without anybody's eyes closed, say.  It's compact yet solid; the menu is easy to navigate, the options are limited, though, if you like to tweak around with your camera.  There are four main settings, the other three being 'best picture possible', which really does take the best possibility, although the lag time after is quite long, so you can't take another photo for several beats, 'motion snapshot' which i haven't hardly used since the camera takes such great motion snapshots on the regular setting, and movie.I love my SLR's pictures, but it's a pain to carry around.  The J1 is easy to carry around, even with the larger 30-110 lens, you just sling it around your shoulder and you don't even notice it there.  I don't know much about mirrorless, other than the light isn't reflected through a mirror and goes straight to forming the image, but the J1 takes fast, fabulous photos.  The color is really rich and details crisp.  Depth of field is thick, the image sensors do a good job focusing on what you want to focus on.  The interchangeable lenses give a variety of options, the 10-30 lens being your workhorse lens, and the 30-110 for outside.  They are easy to change in and out.  The flash is a bit goofy; it pops up out of the body of the camera on a telescope.  Which is where you hold the camera, so your finger blocks it.  The camera does a decent to good job of indoors light, if you are going to use the camera mainly for indoors you might want to look elsewhere, the flash is the weakest aspect.What I was looking for in a camera was something like a reporter's camera.  My dream camera is a Leica but that remains a dream.  The J1 fit all my camera requirements: can carry it with you without being a hassle, takes quality photos, interchangeable lenses, fast.  So I could take photos of Spider Man for my job as a reporter for the Daily Bugle.  The J1 takes great photos, very rapidly.  You don't lose much in the way of image-quality from an SLR, at least not to my unprofessional eyes.  The J1 is a sporty jaunt of a camera; I am very happy with mine.  4 and 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: I'm Glad I Kept my Canon
Reviews.Author: L. Mack Hall
Reviews.Content: The Nikon J1 sometimes takes good-enough pictures, but the cheap, flimsy external wheels are knocked off settings every time you take the camera out of your pocket, and the internal settings have recently taken to winking out.  Re-setting is NOT easy.  The latest misadventure is that the camera images are now often dark and thus useless.Nikon is not friendly about questions - one fellow asked a serious question about a problem with his J1 and the techno-Klingon at Nikon told him nothing except to read page 125 -- the J1 manual has only 75 pages.I am so glad I kept my bulky old Canon.

Reviews.Title: Not for your basic picture taker
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: My Dad purchased this for me as a present. He's very good with cameras though I am not. I'm pretty much a point and shoot kind of girl but he figured I could take some higher quality pictures of my kids with relative ease without having to lug around a big camera. I like the premise of the camera however if I were to pick a camera myself I probably would get something even more simplistic than this. It definitely was not worth the price for someone like me. I'm sure if you're more advance with cameras you would love this camera. However my biggest complaint is I find it hard to take a picture that are not blurry. I don't know if I have the wrong settings or what but others have looked at it and not been able to fix the problem. I've found if I'm taking a picture of a non-moving object the first couple will be blurry. But if I take my time and push the button to take the picture part-way several times it can take a beautiful picture that is crystal clear. However when I'm trying to get my kids they're usually moving and I don't get the same result. I also don't like how long it takes to actually take the picture once I hit the button. With kids I want something nearly instant because it seems like I'm always missing my shot. My camera came with a second lens but I've never used it. I'm sure this is a high quality camera that many would love but for someone not very advanced in the camera spectrum I'd suggest a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Not so much
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Brown
Reviews.Content: Own and use Canon 60D, Nex 5 and Nex 7.  Was looking for a smaller camera to take so I didn't have to load up on the more expensive/bigger cams.  Not impressed!  My 60D is still my camera of choice next to the NEX 7

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Damie
Reviews.Content: This camera is so amazing! Its greater than any other camera that I've had since this is my first photography camera. I love all of the features and its so easy to use. I have to learn more about its features but hopefully I'll figure it our sooner or later.

Reviews.Title: Good One.
Reviews.Author: roshani
Reviews.Content: Good one. Bought this for my mom. She always take photo on AUTO and have no idea on Manual's and exposure settings.And I have to say Auto feature of this camera is very good. Takes really good photo's with strong flash built.Good one for those peoples who like to click pictures all the time in quick mode.

Reviews.Title: J1 a design Mess.. Total Auto or Real Photographic Knowledge needed.. No learners need apply.
Reviews.Author: K. Edwards "K~E"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daughter.  My old DSLR was just too big for her hands and it had no live view.There are two people who might enjoy the Nikon J1.  The ones who want to put it in auto and get better pictures than a phone camera.  Its list price is way to expensive, its black Friday blow out price may be OK for this.Advanced users who don't mind leaning a menu system and understand the use of Aperture Priority and Shutter Priority.They will be able to get control over the camera.Its loaded with odd features that might be fun but will get little use after the gimmick wares off.  Short bursts of slow motion  A mode that takes a shot than appends slow motion with music to it.. Really?  Who asked for that?Who will not like this camera.. anyone who has ever used a basic digital camera and was hoping for a better quality upgrade.  And wants some moderate control.We have not been out taking pictures yet and I am trying to decide if I can return it after the kid named it.One of the useful features for the intermediate photographer that Phone cameras to DSLRS have is Scene modes.  Beach, Sports, Portrait.  Macro etc.  This camera is devoid of them.. In an auto mode it will choose the scene and tell you what it thinks .. but you can't over-ride it.If I sound grumpy.. I am teaching photography to 5th and 6th graders including my daughter and got her this camera for the class.  OMG I can't teach her to think about the shot and choose a scene mode. And the class is not geared towards more advanced camerasI would love to get into the  Aperture and Shutter speeds more.. but most of the kids come to class with P&S; and scene modes so I have adapted the class to them.There is no INBETWEEN mode for people to move from full AUTO to Making more controlled choices.The Nikon lens may be fine.. the Sensor may be fine and the still image tests I looked at before getting the camera were good.But usage wise this camera is a USER INTERFACE DISASTER...  I see now why the Sony NEXs even older models cost soo much and several sellers were blowing these J1s out at under $200... It is a design mess.UPDATE:  I would like more control as stated above... But my 10 year old is loving the camera.  Just the right size and it makes decent choices about which "scene mode" it should use.  I can get at more user controls and will start teaching her that.  The image quality is great.  I would buy a Sony APC Alpha 6000 or Alpha $5000 if this was its original price.  But the bargains on these for Referbs etc.  Make this a much better choice than any of the Sub $200 Point and Shoots.

Reviews.Title: Nice quality pics
Reviews.Author: Ganesh
Reviews.Content: I do have Canon T3i SLR Camera, ofcourse the SLRs have their advantage... This Camera is close to those pics...

Reviews.Title: Average Joe Rating: Color is bad
Reviews.Author: christopher dornbach
Reviews.Content: I've had some high end point and shoots and lower end digital SLRs and high end 35mm and have never had the issues that I have with this camera. I purchased this camera to photograph my work and completely rely on images for future sales. My beef with the camera is the colors and tone look great in the view finder but I can rarely get the camera to capture the image that way regardless of settings and mode. As soon as the image is taken and it shows the review, it looks like a totally different scene. It's always darker or washed out and green and rarely close to what it actually is. It was a refurbished camera so maybe it was returned as defective for the above reasons and the factory checked it and saw that it powered up and took images and called it good? I really don't know but my iPhone takes better images in terms of color and tone. The only thing that has impressed me is that I can take a picture in a very dark room without a flash and the camera pulls out the image. For someone who would rather rely on lighting rather than a flash and doesn't mind messing with the color in PhotoShop it might be ok but for the amount of money, it should be able to take a nice photo. I would have given it 2.5 stars if I could as I do like the function, look, and feel of the camera. Other than that, I feel like I was a little ripped off and if I had purchased it locally, I would have been back to the store with it the next day.

Reviews.Title: Nikon 1 J1
Reviews.Author: ezelle1
Reviews.Content: My new Nikon camera came just as advertised, perfect. We are not fanatical picture takers so the 10-30mm lens is just the right size to take great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: JRPerez61
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!  I have been playing with it for the past month and I haven't been dissappointed.  Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Liza
Reviews.Content: Small, beautiful.I like the pictures quality it makes.Night pictures are very well too. Without the flash I mean.I need to learn a little bit how to use it (diaphragm and  etc.) but till now I am very satisfied.The red back is awesome :)

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Ap
Reviews.Content: Comming from a nikon dslr, i was looking for a smaller more portable camera without sacrificing image quality. The nikon 1 j1 is perfect it performs outstandingly well in all situations and lighting and it is easy to use. I also love it because nikon makes a converter so you can use any nikor mount lens. If youre looking for a step up from a point and shoot or a step down from a dslr this camera is the best of both worlds!

Reviews.Title: 2nd Best "point and shoot" camera (though it's really an MILC).
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: While technically not a point and shoot camera, the Nikon 1 J1 provides all the functionality of a good point and shoot, while yielding much better image quality than the majority of them out there.  It is only bested by Sony's new boutique point and shoots, which cost between $500-800.  This Nikon 1 J1 two lens kit is widely available new for $249 (if you look), and for that price it is a slam dunk value.  It takes lovely pictures that rival those that come out of my expensive aps-c and micro 4/3 cameras.Up Side:  Good Image Quality, good metering, fast focusing, nice lenses, attractive, compact, good in low light, some cool features (best shot works great), affordable and expandable system, Nikon not abandoning it (already up to version 4), inconspicuous and silent for street shooting, takes inexpensive filters.Down Side:  Much better options if you are paying the full price; not the highest pixel count; lens mechanism is a little dumb; more scenes that could be manually chosen would be nice; would love an EVF (available on upgrade V1); a little small for my hands.Check the firmware.  Latest version is 1.4.  Mine came with 1.2 and was easy to upgrade via software on Nikon website.  Do not regret this purchase in the least.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures (equivalent to my canon rebel xt 350D) maybe even a little better quality color/sharpness? Easy to use for me, navigation was a breeze...some pretty cool DSLR type functions. Lightweight, GREAT HD video & it is a pretty sharp looking camera too! Very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: faster then expected.
Reviews.Author: Wyatt Wheeler
Reviews.Content: The tracker said it would take 2-3weeks but I got in just a few days. Product works well and had no sign of damage.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Arabell
Reviews.Content: It was good! Took a little long but very good. evrrything was to be syned for which is always very good

Reviews.Title: Camera looks brand new
Reviews.Author: p. lee
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive DSLR like camera that did more than a point and shoot camera that was light weight

Reviews.Title: easy to pack
Reviews.Author: kuhnie
Reviews.Content: I like this camera.  Very easy to take with you.  I have a Canon Rebel, so this is for packing when I don't want to lug around a big camera.  Takes very good pictures. Nice camera.  The video is also good and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Cesar V.
Reviews.Content: the 10mm lens is perfect for low light conditions. The slow motion funtion is nice but you'll need a good source of light otherwise is going to look blurry.

Reviews.Title: Great value on quality product.
Reviews.Author: Scott K.
Reviews.Content: Several other vendors were selling this camera, but their descriptions were not clear if they were including the extra lens. This vendor was clear about the product they were selling and what was included. I received my purchase in the time frame they promised. The product was flawless and I felt like I got a great price.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: kimberly holmes
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera takes amazing pictures - very crisp and clear. Would recommend buying this camera if you're in the market for a great size and awesome quality.

Reviews.Title: Not bad but the slow motion video is unimpressive
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take slow motion videos to analyze equipment.  The slow mo video is too low resolution to be useful for seeing any detail.  The pictures on auto settings aren't as good as a much less expensive Cannon SX 260.I will probably use this camera for outside slow mo shots of mountain biking.  I think it may be okay for something like that on a bright sunny day.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Oberleitner
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife and she loves it!  The camera is easy to use and the pictures are sharp and clear.  The telephoto lens is perfect long range shots during vacation etc.

Reviews.Title: Great quality of images; perfect for versatility; good mix between manual and point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Lauren Walker-Arsenault
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my J1. Its a versatile camera which can be used for the more advanced photographer or those just learning. Its easy to use and compact enough to carry for everyday trips; quality of images is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: This is the One!
Reviews.Author: Edison
Reviews.Content: Wow! Best camera I have ever bought.  Pictures are awesome and the video even better than my video recorder hd!!!

Reviews.Title: simply love it!
Reviews.Author: Rolando Alaniz jr
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. awesome pictures! i recommend this camera to anyone looking to buy one. shop around but for the price you will not find a better deal then here

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Donna Abbott
Reviews.Content: Small camera, but very powerful.  Has many features that are easy to find and use.  Would recommend this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Love the HD
Reviews.Author: delsdeals "reader"
Reviews.Content: Pictures taken with this camera are beautiful. The features in this small camera are those like a larger more complex camera. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Love the size and portability.
Reviews.Author: L.J.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer so I don't need a huge clunky SLR, but I was never satisfied with regular hand cameras, especially since cameras on smartphones are so advanced these days. The Nikon 1 has much better photo quality and you can even swap out lenses for that real professional grade look you're going for but it's small enough to fit into a hand bag and isn't too heavy either. Highly recommended for those who travel a lot and like packing light.

Reviews.Title: Gift for mom
Reviews.Author: Jenb
Reviews.Content: My mom did a lot of research and really wanted this camera because it is so small but can take great picture as if she had a much larger camera. Amazon by far has the best price for this camera. I got this camera for my mom as a gift and she has been using is constantly ever since and seems to really like it

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality!!!!
Reviews.Author: Teresa
Reviews.Content: Very Vivid Pics!  I am by no means a professional photographer...this camera makes picture taking easy!  I love it!  :)

Reviews.Title: BEST camera I've ever bought
Reviews.Author: Julie A. Shilk "Happy Shopper"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great action shots, especially in a gym.  They don't turn yellow or orange and the pics are clear.I just love this camera.  I've been using it since Christmas. I'm not a professional photographer but boy do I feel like one when I use my camera! lol... Best camera ever.

Reviews.Title: compact, light
Reviews.Author: Gene Smith
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures even in low light without a flashEasy to operate, great value for the money,  Wife loves it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon J1
Reviews.Author: J. Rivera
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera!!! Acquired at a excellent price! I would give it five stars if I knew how to work the damn thing. I bought for my lady who's a camera guru. I just take pics... :]

Reviews.Title: Ease of use
Reviews.Author: Eros A.
Reviews.Content: This is the second camera I acquired equal. The first and second for my daughter for my wife. Easy to use, excelent lenses.

Reviews.Title: I am still learning.
Reviews.Author: Amy Perrine
Reviews.Content: I am still learning the Nikon J1 but so far I like it.  This is my first nice camera I have owned so I am on a learning curve here.  It is very user friendly and not a bad looking camera.  It is small enough for me to carry without using the strap but with the extra lens I have a camera bag.The lens are easy to change and really shoot a clear picture.  I still get a little noise in my photos but with time I will learn the techniques to over come this.Over all the Nikon J1 is a great buy.  I cant wait to continue learning and taking great pictures with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Tracie White
Reviews.Content: I spent months researching different cameras.  This one exceeded my expectations!  It is easy to use and takes wonderful pictures!  Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Christy
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my daughter and she is very happy with the pictures it takes and the convenience.

Reviews.Title: Compact photo camera.
Reviews.Author: Juan Mario Mongini
Reviews.Content: The camera met my expectations. It is small with great capabilities. Lenses are great! The 10-30 zoom is very flexible.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: travelinmama
Reviews.Content: We ended up returning this camera. We wanted an "all-in-one" camera to take traveling, but we were really disappointed with the pictures that it took. While some looked spectacular, I feel that my point and shoot does a better job in the more everyday situations. Until this camera is improved, we'll be taking both our SLR and point and shoot with us on trips.

Reviews.Title: I love my little red baby
Reviews.Author: K. R. Williams
Reviews.Content: I don't know that it reinvents the wheel, I still use my D7000 for anything truly important, but this girl is fast and light and a ton of fun to shoot with.

Reviews.Title: nikon1 J1
Reviews.Author: wuggsy
Reviews.Content: I recieved my order faster than expected.  I am completely thrilled with my purchase.I would purchase again from this company without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dick Mandemaker "PLM expert"
Reviews.Content: The compactness of this camera is great, and the quality of the images is fantastic, so it really is an excellen buy!

Reviews.Title: Nikon j1
Reviews.Author: grzesmacias
Reviews.Content: easy to use ,makes great pictures ,looks awesome no comparison to similar products  , i'm very happy that i bought this product.

Reviews.Title: Overall very good
Reviews.Author: Francisco Quesada
Reviews.Content: Very good indeed.All I would add is a nice casing.Very good focusing and lightweight,maybe another color would be nice.

Reviews.Title: Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: sp
Reviews.Content: Great compact camera with very good video- HD capabilities. Alas, Apple devices do NOT handle the HD video files! Shame on Apple

Reviews.Title: Good Camera!
Reviews.Author: Miguel Gaspar
Reviews.Content: Still learning to use it fully, but a good product, have made good pictures with it, great camera, thinking of buying now the additional lense.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Diane Volgenau
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son last year he loves it and gets to catch action shots of wake boarding and skiing.. he says best camera ever!

Reviews.Title: Excelent!
Reviews.Author: Jhon Jaiver López Calderón
Reviews.Content: This product has fulfilled all the expectations. Great bundle for the price. The len is great for macro shots, if you want more power, get the next lens ref (30 - 110 mm) and the cam becomes perfect.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Robin j
Reviews.Content: On time and no complaints this was a gift an they love the camera and the color res was a great hit!

Reviews.Title: good thing
Reviews.Author: xdu
Reviews.Content: I love it. It is just as i wanted. I will recommed it to my friends and my collegues. The color is also my favorite.

Reviews.Title: Love it！
Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: Love the color soooo much!!!!!! The quality of photos are excellent; so I think the price is really worth it..

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Alan C. Nash "Loral"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she is delighted with it.  It has 90% of the capability of a SLR while being a much more manageable size.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Douglas Stanley
Reviews.Content: Bought for my daughter, she loves it!  Will recommend as a future purchase for anyone.  Three things I'd recommend to purchase a long with it.  A case, a remote and a cleaning kit,.

Reviews.Title: nikon delight
Reviews.Author: PHILLIP J MCDONALD
Reviews.Content: I had an old nikon camera this far sup passes my old one.It's smaller lighter and easer to use.It's certainly on the way for serious professional photography .

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Dieu T. Huynh
Reviews.Content: It takes beautiful pictures.It's not regular point and shoot camera, so you have to spend sometime and effort to play around with the setting to get the most out of it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: Only thing is I wish I would have gotten the extra lens package. Love it!! The camera is really great!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: gabby
Reviews.Content: nikon 1 j1 really really good. The focus is really nice and not so heavy. I bough the nikon 1 j1 10-30mm bundle with memory card and the bag. The camera is really cool semi slr and digital, and great for take a picture in vacation, but the color of the bag is a little bit bad and not match with the color of camera. If the bag's color is black it'll me AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: loved this camra
Reviews.Author: jan
Reviews.Content: i baught this camra i love it too. the only thing i would change is the flash would go off when i want it to. i love using flash for all of me pics so it would of been nice. but other than that i loved it

Reviews.Title: Flash stopped working
Reviews.Author: S. Sowell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after playing with it a bit at the store.  Really had high hopes for it! This was my first Nikon purchase, normally I only buy Canon cameras.  After just one week the flash stopped working completely.  The icon would come up showing it was ready and charged but would not fire.  I am not sure if it was a mechanical problem or if the bulb burnt out but after only one week I didn't care.  I took it back and will be going back to Canon.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY!! BROKE WITHIN DAYS!!!
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera in the world! It broke within days and the factory had to send me a new one...THAT broke within days. I think I may have taken 5 pictures in total with it. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!

Reviews.Title: Please don't buy Nikkon defect product
Reviews.Author: Huabin Wang
Reviews.Content: I used to highly recommend Nikon product.  But after I bought it for 6 months it showed error message and no picture could be taken.  I totally destroyed my high quality Nikon image.  Even worse, I filled out the online repair service.  First they didn't send me any email back to confirm.  After I mailed my defected camera I need to call them for more information.  Then after finally they got my camera and information Nikon service want to charge me a service fee.  But my camera is still under warraty. Plus, please don't believe they have 24-h service.  You can only get through in the morning.  Anyway, I am very dispointed so far.  I will keep posting the progress.1/4/2013 Only body was received and said no problem. So weird. I sent both body and lense.1/19/2013 I received the lense.  It indicated that the problem had been resolved.  I tested today.  My camera works again. I changed review to 3 stars due to their good service.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Zach and Britney
Reviews.Content: The deal that I got on this camera was amazing!  The camera itself performs very well. We are not pros in photography so I thought this would be a  great entry level shooter!  Although it is an older model..it compares very well to the newer generations! The shipment was fast and the camera is stylish! Very cool!

Reviews.Title: Nikon 1 J1
Reviews.Author: irJIM
Reviews.Content: Pro:Camera is small & compact,  lenses are small, quick focusing, heavy duty built, sharp detail pics when right on, Image Stabalizing is great. LCD is good & detailed.Cons: Interface controls slow, battery life too short, flash stopped working after 3 days.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: docmom49
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and it is only one of many that I own. I love that it is compact and has lenses that are changeable. It takes great crisp pictures and is point-and-shoot. All you have to worry about is composition!

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend
Reviews.Author: Cassie
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera. I love it. It's small and very pretty, and it's easy to use. The case is very good as well.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: combs545
Reviews.Content: I absolutly love this camera. It takes great pictures. They are so clear and even when my kids are playing basketball, they are clear, not fuzzy pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Cristina Macias Rivero "Cristy Macias"
Reviews.Content: Best camera ever!!Super light and great pictures!!Great camera, i just loved it!!Bought it for a anniversary trip to san francisco and got great pictures!!

Reviews.Title: Fast focusing camera in well lit areas with high fps
Reviews.Author: GTO1965
Reviews.Content: I rated it 4 stars since it was recently reduced in price.  At the current price of $499 with the 10-30mm and 30-110mm lens as well as the memory card and case makes it worth it.  But for the old list price of $650 with just the 10-30mm lens and $249 for the $30-110mm lens, I believe that it was way too expensive and would only give it a 3 star at most.  Needed to replace my old point and shoot that was dying.  Wanted something better than a point and shoot but smaller than my D700 to carry around for smaller outings.The camera focuses fast and the pictures come out pretty good as long as you keep the ISO at 800 and under.  3200 ISO has way too much noise, due to the smaller sensor size.  1600 ISO is OK but you will notice a bit more noise.  On my D700 you can go much higher with the ISO and it still looks really decent.  There is slight barrel distortion on the 10-30mm lens as well as some slight darkening around the corners.  They already have a lens profile for it in Lightroom that will take care of the problem.  Overall the picture quality is nice and sharp and has good color.  It's also pretty fast and can shoot 5fps with raw + jpg, which is pretty impressive since that as fast as my D700 without the additional battery pack.I had just purchased the camera last month and one thing I noticed was that the firmware on the camera and lens where out of date.  There was already two newer versions of the firmware out for the camera and one for the lens.  Make sure you update your camera and lens to the latest firmware, it may fix some of the blurry picture issues that people have been complaining about in the camera.One thing that I don't really care for it is in the scene select mode, you can't select the range of the auto-ISO setting so it will end up using ISO 3200 on your shots.  If you use a different mode like P,A,S,M then you can adjust the auto-ISO to a lower setting.Another issue is that there is no auto pop up flash.  You have to manually raise the flash before taking a picture.  They should had a setting to auto pop up the flash for more novice users.  This fine for a more advanced user but for someone who is less familiar will have a harder time to remember when to turn it on, especially in difficult lighting situation.  I've have always used SLRs where you had to manually turn on the flash so this is not a problem for me.  But for my wife it's a different story.  And this camera is mainly for her.  Also the pop up flash looks kind of flimsy, just hope it will last.  Would have preferred a flash built onto the front of the camera.Battery life is so-so.  Make sure to get an extra battery.  It doesn't last that long.  I was reading online that it always has the VR on at all times as opposed to only on when you depress the shutter button.  So I'm sure this causes it to drain much faster.  Also I noticed that the VR is set to active by default.Video is not very good at low light situations.  For, indoor shooting, a lot of times it looks way too dark on screen.  It's much worse than my old Sony camcorder.  In bright light the video looks good.  Plus you can also take pictures while your are filming video.  They have slow motion shooting but it's limited to such a short time frame so it's really not all that useful.  Plus the resolution on the slow motion is much lower.  It's more of a gimmick than anything else.Overall it's a decent camera with certain limitations.  I wanted a smaller camera that you can use like a point and shoot but with a bit more control and better low light picture quality that you would get with a slightly larger sensor.

Reviews.Title: Superb Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Chabalik
Reviews.Content: Great Camera - Don't be fooled by the "low" megapixel rating - This camera takes exceptional quality shots with an extremely fast shutter speed.  This is my 3rd Nikon Camera and I am very pleased with the purchase already.  Got it for a great deal (as always on Amazon) with the lens, memory card and case.  Could not be happier, what a value in the sub $500 dollar range.  Would highly recommend for all camera skill levels.  It is far less cumbersome than a standard SLR but takes very similar quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Nikon 1 J1 - SLR Features - Compact Size
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: Great camera with quality images.  The controls are very intuitive and easy to use.  I reccomend the two lens zoom package.  The camera has many of the features of a full-size SLR yet is compact enough to fit in a purse.

Reviews.Title: best camera ever
Reviews.Author: emily monahan
Reviews.Content: This is a great alternative to lugging around my huge slr.Compact, fast responses, and a variety of lenses and accessories.

Reviews.Title: Great balance of flexibility, fast focus, image quality, and portability
Reviews.Author: SoCalEnthu "chipdesigner"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera - it is a perfect combination of:flexibility - interchangable lenses give me a nice telephoto for sports (kids soccer) and a 10-30 lens for everyday. And it takes HD video, so my camera becomes a video camera with telephoto.fast focus - I just point and shoot and the focus is very rapid, so I don't miss an important shot. There is even a special mode that takes 20 shots in quick succession and selects 5 to keep and 1 as a favorite. Great for capturing the moment when the foot hits the ball or other action events.image quality - the image quality is excellent, including when printing a full page (8 x 10). Larger may be fine too, but I haven't done that (yet).portability - the camera is relatively compact (for its features) and lightweight. Compared to a standard DSLR (for example, Nikon D5100 that my son owns) it is tiny and much lower weight. So I don't feel like I have a big weight around my neck.Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera for me
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I wanted an easy to use camera that was small.the pictures are greatthe size is perfectthe price was rightI took over 400 pictures during my vacation in Hawaii and downloaded them--they were excellent

Reviews.Title: Its great for $600 dollars
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: This camera is great as a step up from point and shoot. it takes a really good video, i was impressed!! I think i was more impressed by video than photos. it may not be as good as $1,000 video camera, but very close. It probably has the best audio recording in video compared to similar cameras. Metering is good most of the time, noise is limited, I was really impressed by this $600 camera except for colors, not a fan of skin colors. I would buy it just for video and speed of the camera, focus is very good.Its in the same price range with sony nex-5n and I've used both cameras. both cameras have their own advantages, but I would take nex-5n if i had to pick one. Image and Video Quality is better with new-5n. Focusing, audio and overall speed is better with Nikon j1. Nex-5n has a very useful titable touch screen, which can be used to change focus points during video recording.

Reviews.Title: Bright medium DSLR like alternative
Reviews.Author: beSuretoBuy
